PeopleTalkFirst.Hero: Hey, have you ever heard of the déjà vu effect? Have you ever felt this way?
No, this is the first time I hear about it. What's this?
In short, this is when a person feels that he has already been in a similar situation or in a similar place, said such things.

EdWalkUpPeople.Hero: Oh huh, are they going to pity me?
Let's go.
Now for half an hour listening to "I'm sorry", "I sympathize" and "how is it, man, it's not fair" and the like.
Hey, hello!
Ed, where's your smile?
Okay, coming soon. We have good news for you.
I won't need to help anyone? Otherwise, I’ll probably refuse right away, I’ve already had enough, to be honest...
No, don't worry. We are just about this situation.
In short, it's good that you slept a little, otherwise it happened in the morning...
At first, when Bob and I entered the office, security and boss were discussing something, but I'm curious enough, and decided to overhear.
In general, we know that you hacked the locked door.
Yes, Mark came up and said that you didn't just break open the door, but also stole something.
We obviously did not believe it, because it seemed to us as strange as possible.
In short, to tell you the essence, listen.
We convinced the boss that Mark set you up.
It seems that this trap was not his goal, but the point is that you were in the "right place at the right time".
Well, your skills also played a role.
You won't get fired, Ed, you can relax.
Yes, that jerk Mark is fired. Hell, I never liked him.
Even his appearance is so... specific.
This is how villains usually look.
Yes, that's what I wanted to say.
So guys, wait a minute.
So, you mean, boss understood everything and just forgave me?
Yes, he got it. You didn't even know what was behind this door, and you yourself did not even open it.
I find it hard to believe so far...
Why? It's really not your fault, so relax.
And I'm also wondering why you decided to take care of this and help me?
What a stupid question, Ed?
Don't make us laugh, dude.
The answer is pretty simple. You helped us, and we helped you.
Besides, it literally cost us nothing, but you were so worn out helping us.
Not really, of course.
I find it hard to believe, too.
Dude, keep it simple, as if you never had friends and you can't believe this.
Well, strictly speaking, I really had not.
Now you have, Ed.
Yes, it's kind of strange, ahah.
Thank you guys.
Seriously, even if it didn't cost you anything. Thank you.
I wouldn't be here anymore if not for your help.
Really, never mind.
Dude, don't forget you still have a day plan. You're not fired, so get to work, ahaha.
Yeah, right... I totally forgot about that.
Well... Get to work!

ClickOnWorkspace.Hero: Really, as if I'm in a dream.
Okay, I'll have time to think about it before bed. I have to work, since fate gives me such a chance.
Maybe I jumped to conclusions about Ari's words last night. All the same, these guys really pulled me out of this situation.
This is what it feels like...

SolveDreamPuzzle.Hero: Am I dreaming? Where am I?
Aahha, you fell asleep at work, right on the table.
What? Seriously? What day is it?
Same as before you fell asleep.
Remember, no? You were almost fired today, but nothing happened.
God, I thought I was dreaming about that...
Damn, I'm already lost in dreams and reality.
By the way, yesterday I wanted to talk to you about this...
What about? About realities and dreams? You are so cute.
Yes, it's just a mismatch in my head.
Okay, let's talk now. Let's go, maybe, towards the house. The working day has already ended.
Already? So fast? I thought I only slept a few minutes.
I think it is. I was looking at you, you fell asleep very recently, so I think that's okay.
Let's go. Get some fresh air, it's very beautiful there now.
Fresh air would be good for me. Need to wake up.
